name: NPR
text:
When D.C. resident Rahul Dubey saw protesters cornered by police, facing pepper spray and arrest for violating curfew, he did what he says anyone else would do:

He invited about 70 strangers to take shelter in his home overnight. 
https://t.co/We2XI1dpP0

name: NPR
text:
The Center for Democracy and Technology argues that President Trump's executive order attempting to strip tech companies of a key legal protection was retaliatory and violates the First Amendment.
https://t.co/DtlSjOiuUu

name: NPR
text:
This early child care center in Spokane has been operating at one-third capacity during the pandemic.

They say it's been difficult having to turn away parents asking about enrollment â€” many of whom are essential workers.
https://t.co/inNOMXJbiP

name: NPR
text:
Louisville Metro Police officials released silent security footage of what they said appears to show David McAtee firing a weapon at officers before they fatally shot him.

In one video, he is holding what appears to be cooking utensils.
https://t.co/CqLOg9wOxi

name: NPR
text: Note: We have deleted a previous tweet and updated this post to include more details of the incident.

name: NPR
text:
JUST IN: Iowa Rep. Steve King has lost his GOP primary, the AP projects. 

For years, he fired off incendiary comments about abortion and race, which lost him the support of many Republican Party leaders.
https://t.co/MAVTtvdgVU

name: NPR
text:
Minnesota has filed a discrimination complaint against the Minneapolis Police Department. The state's 
Lt. Gov. Peggy Flanagan said the action was "needed so that people can feel safe in their communities." https://t.co/TaEctHuGE7

text: In early March, we captured the cast and musicians of the hit Broadway musical @Hadestown pack into the Tiny Desk for a truly glorious performance of its greatest songs. https://t.co/lo1I9T0DiI

name: NPR
text: 15-year-old Jyoti Kumari's 700-mile bike ride to bring her injured father home made her a media celebrity â€” but the coverage has sparked debate on whether she is a hero or a victim of the extreme poverty that lockdowns have only worsened in India. https://t.co/zJcYqHBRg2

name: NPR
text:
Athletes are speaking up about racism â€” from activists like Kareem Abdul-Jabbar to apolitical figures like Michael Jordan. 

This solidarity is bringing awareness to peaceful protests in sports â€” including Colin Kaepernickâ€™s protest, which began in 2016. https://t.co/yO6rv6ZvND
